definition: to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to fall flat on one's face/(martial arts) pouncing and falling (i.e. all kinds of moves)
disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
to change one's viewpoint/to turn from side to side (in bed)
injury such as contusion, sprain or fracture from falling, blow etc

(TCM) "five strains and seven impairments", five referring to the five viscera 五臟|五脏[wu3 zang4], and seven to adverse effects on one's body as a result of: overeating (spleen), anger (liver), moisture (kidney), cold (lung), worry (heart), wind and rain (outer appearance) and fear (mind)
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
to fall down/to take a fall
see 頭昏目眩|头昏目眩[tou2 hun1 mu4 xuan4]
